column1: Micahel is the author of several books

column6: Dr. Oz
column7: CNN
column8: and Larry King Live. Every Friday at 1 pm Pacific Time

column1: Michael is an old friend of mine
column2: and I was honored that he had this conversation with me. I had him on The School of Greatness back on Episode 748

column5: I can stand in solidarity with the black community. I sincerely hope you will stand with me and make positive change happen.

Dr. Joe Dispenza is an international lecturer
column3: corporate consultant
column4: New York Times bestselling author
column5: and educator who has been invited to speak in more than 33 countries on 6 continents. As a lecturer and educator
column6: he is driven by the conviction that each of us has the potential for greatness and unlimited abilities.

column3: he has educated thousands of people
column4: detailing how they can rewire their brains and recondition their bodies to make lasting changes. His most recent book
column6: talks about how we can intentionally change our brain chemistry to initiate profoundly mystical
column7: transcendental experiences and develop a more healthy body

column1: I’ve had Dr. Joe on The School of Greatness a couple times now
column2: and I was so excited to have him back on today. We couldn’t meet in person due to the coronavirus
column3: but we conducted a video interview together that I think you’re really going to enjoy. If you haven’t already
column4: check out our past interviews (Episode 826 and Episode 679) — they are all really applicable to what we are going through right now.

column1: In the hard times we are currently facing
column2: it is so important to take a moment to refocus our minds to prevent ourselves from spiraling into anxiety. Anxiety and depression can chemically change our bodies and even suppress our immune system
column3: and now more than ever
column4: it’s important for us to keep that from happening.

column1: Attitude is everything. When we do feel anxious
column2: there are things we can do to recenter ourselves and raise our consciousness to a higher level. To learn how join me on Episode 933 with the incredible Dr. Joe Dispenza.

column3: entrepreneur and author who co-founded the on-line educational platform Creative Live. Chase consistently uses his voice to educate and inspire people to achieve their creative potential.

column2: Chase Jarvis loved being creative and started making his own films
column3: but after overhearing his teacher tell his parents “Chase is so much better at sports than arts”
column4: he lost his creative passion and replaced it with a need to achieve athletically. In the following years he became a standout athlete in multiple sports
column5: but his grandfather’s death reignited his creative spirit and since that time he has lived a creative life putting his creative spirit into everything he does. Now
column6: his mission is to help people tap into their creative potential.

column1: Dan overworked himself. He was in a hypercompetitive environment where the grind never stopped
column2: and he was a skeptic of self-care and self-love. But one day
column3: he had a nationally televised panic attack on Good Morning America that showed him he couldn’t continue living life the way he had. It made him start to concentrate on his mental health and learn how to be a little happier every day. Dan used to believe meditation was useless
column4: but now he uses that tool to recenter his psyche and body into a calmer

column1: Dave’s journey from a left-leaning progressive to a free-thinking classical liberal has been quite an adventure. As a gay married man living in America
column2: Dave spent the majority of his adult life subscribing to a certain political belief system. Fed up with the mainstream media narrative and click-bait news

column4: but rather they should embrace their status as an individual.

column1: Dave’s background as a stand-up comedian
column3: and his willingness to listen without fighting has uniquely positioned him to tackle big ideas and uncomfortable truths with thought leaders from both sides of the aisle. His show The Rubin Report aims to create civil discourse with people who disagree with each other. He aims to host a dialogue with others where ideas aren’t judged before people have the chance to explain.

Now I’m committed to impacting 100 million lives. I teach people how to pursue the dream that burns inside them and how to earn a full time income while making an impact on the world and others.
I do this through my podcast
column3: books
column4: online courses
column6: experiential workshops and one on one interactions.

column1: I’m so grateful where life has taken me and the life that I’ve chosen to design on a daily basis. I believe we are the authors of our own life
column2: and I’m blessed for the adversity I’ve faced. It makes me appreciate my life now and have compassion for others who suffer in a much bigger way.

column1: I’m often asked to mentor others

column1: Please say hi over on Instagram

column1: Always remember you were born for a reason
column2: a purpose and something bigger than yourself. But YOU have to activate this calling; no one is going to turn it on for you! It’s Your Responsibility to build yourself into the person who can live a great life. No one is going to give you the power to develop your mental strength
column3: emotional intelligence and physical health to have the life you want. That’s between you and you!

column1: 140 "7zngYfRGsPs" "How To FIGHT VIRUSES (Including COVID-19) & NEVER GET SICK AGAIN | Dr. Steven Gundry & Lewis Howes" "2020-08-10T16:35:26Z" "Dr. Steven Gundry began his career as a cardiac surgeon. But eventually
column2: he realized that surgery wasn’t enough to solve the problems underlying his patients’ health problems. So today
column3: Dr. Gundry is dedicated to helping his patients avoid surgery. He has spent decades researching and developing a unique perspective on diet and nutrition
column4: and he teaches his patients how to have a healthy microbiome and live a long and surgery-free life.

column1: Dr. Gundry is a multi-time New York Times bestselling author. His most recent book
column3: teaches readers to maximize health by maintaining a healthy microbiome. And his upcoming book
column4: The Energy Paradox

column1: 151 "8ZqAKNPxaxc" "HARVARD SCIENTIST REVEALS The Surprising Secrets To AGE IN REVERSE | David Sinclair & Lewis Howes" "2020-09-09T15:46:26Z" "In the last couple of years
column2: David and his team have found that there is a “backup hard drive of youthfulness” in the cell. Their mission is to access that hard drive and reset it – to turn on those longevity genes. They’ve learned that the sooner you start turning those on
column3: the better.

column1: “We now know from studying twins that 80% of your health in old age is up to you
column2: how you live your life.” – Dr. David Sinclair

column1: So how do you turn them on? There are five simple steps:

column2: don’t smoke. We’ve all heard this before – cigarettes will kill you – but with the rise of smoking alternatives
column3: such as vaping
column4: this warning is still very applicable. The chemicals we put in our lungs have a significant effect on our body chemistry and health. Smoking damages cellular DNA and accelerates the aging process – It’s undeniable. David’s mother died from lung cancer. She smoked
column6: had a tumor the size of a grapefruit in her left lung. They took out the tumor
column7: and she lived another 20 years
column8: but in excruciating pain and hardship.

column2: don’t eat too much. And that doesn’t just apply to the “unhealthy foods” – it applies to food in general. Dr. Sinclair isn’t recommending malnutrition
column3: of course
column4: but a healthy amount of intermittent fasting. Skipping a meal a day is okay
column5: even if you’re an athlete. He recommends to stop eating when you’re about 60 or 70% full. We’re conditioned to eat the food in front of us at a young age – who else was encouraged to have a “clean plate” as a kid? But fasting can help turn on those longevity genes.

column1: #3. Third is the obvious: High Intensity Interval Training (what we call “HIIT” workouts). In these moments of extreme physical stress and mental toughness
column3: which is another word for “lacking oxygen.” When you’re out of breath
column4: your blood is flowing
column6: and those longevity genes are turned on. We need to be in survival mode to fight back against aging
column7: but the truth is
column8: we spend our whole lives trying to reduce adversity. It’s ironic that a passive
column9: comfortable life actually reduces our lifespan
column10: but it’s true. Get out there and break a sweat.

column1: #4. Fourth is the type of food you eat. Dr. David Sinclair recommends eating plant-based foods
column2: and also healthy amounts of monounsaturated fats – like olive oil and avocados. These fatty acids are great for your body and some contain polyphenols
column3: which are molecules that plants make when they’re stressed. Eating “stressed food” actually activates those longevity genes. Red wine is another example – It’s full of polyphenols and one in particular called “resveratrol” that Dr. Sinclair and his team have been studying for 20 years. It activates those longevity pathways really well.

column2: get a good night’s sleep. The body has to restore itself overnight
column3: and if you skip sleep
column4: you are pushing yourself closer and closer into old age. Take a nap every once and while. It’s amazing what it will do for your health.

column1: So there you have it: 5 simple things you can do to live longer. Dr. David Sinclair says that doing those things will at least get you an extra 14 years on average. It’s just living a good life." "UCKsP3v2JeT2hWI_HzkxWiMA" "Lewis Howes" "66659" "2294" "71" "0" "387" "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8ZqAKNPxaxc"

column1: This is audio podcast number #545 with Rupi Kaur

Rupi Kaur is a #1 new york times bestselling author and illustrator of two collections of poetry. she started drawing at the age of five when her mother handed her a paintbrush and said—draw your heart out. rupi views her life as an exploration of that artistic journey. after completing her degree in rhetoric studies she published her first collection of poems milk and honey in 2014. the internationally acclaimed collection sold well over a million copies gracing the new york times bestsellers list every week for over a year. it has since been translated into over thirty languages. her long-awaited second collection ‘the sun and her flowers’ was published in 2017. through this collection she continues to explore a variety of themes ranging from love. loss. trauma. healing. femininity. migration. ‘revolution.
rupi has performed her poetry across the world. her photography and art direction are warmly embraced and she hopes to continue this expression for years to come.
-Why our idea of success is so skewed (7:20)
-What causes us to become our own enemy (17:40)
-How to teach yourself to write from a place of love versus pain (20:40)
-Rupi reading one of her new poems (30:05)
-Rupi’s message to women who have gone through challenging relationships (39:04)

column1: 207 "BpDaBMTAWsw" "BUILDING YOUR PERSONAL ADVISORY BOARD (AKA DREAM TEAM)" "2018-07-02T13:42:24Z" "I know you’ve heard the story of me falling into a funk and sleeping on my sister’s couch for 18 months in my early twenties. One thing you probably didn’t know is how I got out of this funk.

I wanted to record a solo round on this topic because it’s one of the most powerful tools I’ve ever used to shift my life — it’s called creating a personal advisory board. If you haven’t heard of it before
column2: a personal advisory board is a group of people that you build around you to give you wisdom
column3: inspire you
column4: and
column6: create accountability.

column1: You may be wondering what the difference is between an advisor and a mentor — the truth is there is a big difference.
A mentor is someone you look up to. You may know them
column2: but you may not. Chances are
column3: today
column4: any mentor you have can answer your questions through resources they’ve created. Maybe it’s a book
column6: or online articles. Board members are people you know much more intimately. It’s also important they have an invested interest in your success.

column2: they have skin in the game when it comes to you. But it goes beyond that. An advisory board can help you in all aspects of your life. It’s a team for success and they are there to call on throughout the year and see your goals through to the end.

column1: No matter where you are at in your life and business
column2: you need an advisory board. Without it
column3: you’re either going to stay stagnant or move toward your dreams much slower than you could with it.

column1: Learn all about my tips on building the ultimate advisory board

column1: The breathing exercise has a profound effect and should be practiced in the way it is explained. Always do the breathing exercise in a safe environment (e.g. sitting on a couch/floor) and unforced.
Never practice the exercises before or during diving
column3: swimming
column4: taking a bath or in any other environment/place where should you pass out
column5: a serious injury could occur. Wim Hof breathing may cause tingling sensations and/or lightheadedness. If you’ve fainted
column6: it means that you went to far. Take a step back next time.

column1: The cold is a powerful force. We strongly advise to gradually build up exposing yourself to the cold. Always train without force and listen to your body carefully. If it is not practiced responsible
column2: there is a risk of hypothermia.

column1: Do not practice the method during pregnancy or when having epilepsy. Persons with cardiovascular health issues
column3: should always consult a medical doctor before starting with the Wim Hof Method.

column2: starting as an enlisted SEAL and rising the ranks to become a SEAL officer. As commander of SEAL Team Three’s Task Unit Bruiser during the battle of Ramadi
column3: he orchestrated SEAL operations that helped the “Ready First” Brigade of the U.S. Army’s First Armored Division bring stability to the violent
column4: war-torn city. Task Unit Bruiser became the most highly decorated Special Operations Unit of the Iraq War. Jocko returned from Iraq to serve as Officer-In-Charge of Training for all West Coast SEAL Teams. There he spearheaded the development of leadership training and personally instructed and mentored the next generation of SEAL leaders who have continued to perform with great success on the battlefield.

column2: Jocko retired from the Navy and launched Echelon Front with Leif Babin
column3: where he teaches the leadership principles he learned on the battlefield to help others lead and win.

column1: Jocko has put together leadership principles that will help you become a successful leader.

274 "e7NaKxNoY1Y" "This Was Holding Me Back From Success | Lewis Howes Motivation" "2018-05-24T09:21:40Z" "Thank you Goalcast for editing this video! You can follow them here:
Thank you for watching this video!
I put all of this negative and lonely energy into my dream of being a professional athlete
column3: an Olympian. I went on to play Arena Football for one season
column4: but a career ending injury shattered my identity. I didn’t know who I was without sports.

column1: Would anyone still want to hang out with me?
What will I do for the rest of my life now???

column3: and clueless on how to make money or get a career
column4: my obsession for learning about business
column6: product design
column7: human behavior
column8: and adding value to people (when I had no value to give) began.

column1: Since then it’s been a powerful journey for me – becoming a New York Times bestselling author
column2: building up a multi-million dollar online media company
column3: speaking all over the world
column4: advising for billion dollar brands
column5: receiving media praise from places like Details Magazine
column6: being one of “5 Internet Gurus Who Can Make You Rich” and much more. I’m a firm believer that living in a beautiful state
column7: the journey you experience
column8: and the lives you impact is more important than what you do or what you have accumulated. I got a taste of being a pro athlete for a short amount of time. And I realized early on that when I commit to my vision and pursue it with 100% passion… anything is possible. Living my ideal lifestyle is far more important to me than working on something I don’t fully love just to survive life and then die.

column1: It’s hard to think that without having any business experience I could go from sleeping on my sister’s couch to running a seven figure business in a couple years. Now I’m committed to impacting 100 million lives. I teach people how to pursue the dream that burns inside them and how to earn a full time income while making an impact on the world and others.
I do this through my podcast
column3: books
column4: online courses
column6: experiential workshops and one on one interactions. I’m so grateful where life has taken me and the life that I’ve chosen to design on a daily basis. I believe we are the authors of our own life
column7: and I’m blessed for the adversity I’ve faced. It makes me appreciate my life now and have compassion for others who suffer in a much bigger way. I’m often asked to mentor others
column8: and the way I do this is through my podcast so I can maximize my time and impact more people. If you have a question
column9: I’ve probably answered it on one of my episodes.

column1: Please say hi over on Instagram
column3: YouTube or Twitter as I love to hear what each episode is bringing up for you and the lessons you are learning.

column1: Always remember you were born for a reason
column2: a purpose and something bigger than yourself. But YOU have to activate this calling; no one is going to turn it on for you! It’s Your Responsibility to build yourself into the person who can live a great life. No one is going to give you the power to develop your mental strength
column3: emotional intelligence and physical health to have the life you want. That’s between you and you!

column1: I know there are times that are challenging
column2: and it may seem like you can’t get out of it. I’m living proof that you can. If a small town boy from Ohio (who didn’t see any potential for his future) can do it
column3: then so can you!

column1: Your dreams matter because YOU Matter! Never forget that
column2: but you must learn the wisdom
column3: skills and tools to write your own story. Be the hero you were born to be. Start the journey with me because the world needs you my friend!

column1: I’ve recorded well over six hundred episodes at this point. There’s been so much knowledge and wisdom from the brightest minds on the planet shared on the show.  I know it can be overwhelming to try to take it all

column4: and Mel Robbins.

column1: Each of these guests has reached the top of their game
column2: and the biggest factor in that has been their habits.

column1: They set their mind to achieve something big and found a way to persevere even at some of the worst times. So what makes them different than you?
They aren’t super human and they aren’t luckier than you. If you take their words of wisdom
column2: you’ll find how to overcome what’s holding you back. I hope you enjoy these nuggets of information I hand selected so you don’t have to dig for them.

column1: 340 "h_1mN9K8D90" "Rupi Kaur | You Have The Power" "2018-02-09T12:22:44Z" "Thanks for watching this video! Let me know in the comments below.
Full interview with Rupi Kaur Full Interview:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9cHCaUA5ahA&t=891s

Rupi Kaur is a #1 new york times bestselling author and illustrator of two collections of poetry. she started drawing at the age of five when her mother handed her a paintbrush and said—draw your heart out. rupi views her life as an exploration of that artistic journey. after completing her degree in rhetoric studies she published her first collection of poems milk and honey in 2014. the internationally acclaimed collection sold well over a million copies gracing the new york times bestsellers list every week for over a year. it has since been translated into over thirty languages. her long-awaited second collection ‘the sun and her flowers’ was published in 2017. through this collection she continues to explore a variety of themes ranging from love. loss. trauma. healing. femininity. migration. ‘revolution.
rupi has performed her poetry across the world. her photography and art direction are warmly embraced and she hopes to continue this expression for years to come.

By age 26 he had established a $4 million real estate portfolio
column2: only to lose it by age 30. Using the wisdom he gained
column3: Ramsey rebuilt his financial life and now teaches others how to be responsible with their money
column4: so they can acquire enough wealth to take care of loved ones
column6: and give generously to others. In 1992
column7: he started a business (now called Ramsey Solutions) to help people everywhere use their money profitably and wisely.  Ramsey runs a multi-million-dollar company with a nationally recognized brand
column8: but he defines success by the number of lives changed through his message of hope.

column3: is heard on more than 500 radio stations throughout the United States and Canada. Dave is also the creator of Financial Peace University (FPU)
column4: a program that helps people dump their debt
column6: and learn new behaviors around money that are founded on commitment and accountability.

column1: COVID-19 has not only affected our health but our finances as well. You might be out of a job. You may have lost a ton of money in stocks. Maybe money has always been tight
column2: and you’re scrambling to make ends meet. Don’t let yourself be caught up in fear. There is always hope — even when you hit rock bottom. Don’t make financial decisions based on fear and desperation.

column1: Join me on Episode 938 to learn how to recover from a financial recession and make the most of your money with the one and only Dave Ramsey.

column2: Power Breathing and Brotherhood with Lewis Howes" "2020-02-06T20:39:15Z" "Thank you for watching this powerful interview with Wim Hof!

column1: Check out the show notes here: https://www.lewishowes.com/910
If anyone has mastered their mind
column2: it’s extreme athlete Wim Hof. Wim Hof got his nickname “The Iceman” by breaking a number of records related to cold exposure. His feats include climbing Mount Kilimanjaro in shorts
column3: running a half marathon above the Arctic Circle on his bare feet
column4: and standing in a container while covered with ice cubes for more than 112 minutes. He developed the Wim Hof Method: a natural path to an optimal state of body and mind.

column1: He says that our brains have the power to guarantee us happiness
column3: and health. We can actually regulate our mind and the autonomous nervous system by breathing and being present. I  had the incredible opportunity to travel to Poland along with several other top entrepreneurs and business owners to experience a week with Wim Hof that I will never forget.

column2: we participated in several different exercises. Some involved meditation and breathing and others involved enduring intense cold and ice water challenges. On this trip
column3: we all learned about the importance of brotherhood. Some of the physical challenges would have been unbearable if we were going at it alone. We all had each other to encourage
column4: to motivate

column1: We’ve all been in a place
column3: “I can’t do this anymore.” That’s a mindset roadblock that we were taught to overcome. Often in the midst of being uncomfortable
column4: our minds and bodies panic. Our top priority is becoming comfortable again. But this is not often the correct way to deal with stress or pain.

column2: and if you teach it to avoid pain
column3: then you’ll never reach your full potential. If anyone has mastered the art of being uncomfortable while releasing stress
column4: it’s Wim Hof. He gave all of us an experience we will never forget.

column2: my team and I thought it best to do a special episode on the coronavirus — not to cause fear and panic but to take a moment to educate ourselves on the virus and the best methods for protection. There is so much unknown
column3: so much fear and panic
column4: that it can get really overwhelming — my girlfriend literally made herself sick the other night watching the news.

column2: we should be focusing on what we can do to prevent the virus from spreading and how we can best respond to the chaos around us.

column1: I’ve got my best friend Matthew Cesaratto in the house
column2: and today we have a coffeehouse conversation about the coronavirus
column3: how we should respond
column4: and how we can all be leaders in a time of fear and crisis.

column1: Matt begins the episode by talking about some practical ways to keep the virus from spreading (wash your hands
column3: increase air ventilation
column4: etc.) All this information comes straight from the CDC website
column5: which is a great resource you can use to educate yourself about the virus rather than just media or news outlets.

column2: I give 8 things that we should do in order to stay calm and be leaders in a time of chaos

Maria Sharapova was born on April 19
column3: in Nyagan
column4: Russia. She started playing tennis at an early age and turned professional at the age of 14. In 2007

column9: she started to make a comeback in 2011 when she finished the year ranked 4

column3: becoming the 10th woman to complete a career Grand Slam
column4: winning all four major tennis tournaments.

He was assigned to the Internet Crimes Against Children Task Force and deployed as an undercover operative for the U.S. Child Sex Tourism Jump Team.

Tim has worked every type of case imaginable in the fight to dismantle child trafficking rings. Ballard has worked undercover in the United States and in multiple foreign countries to infiltrate child trafficking organizations. In this effort
column2: he has successfully dismantled dozens of these organizations and rescued countless children from sex slavery. He has trained hundreds of law enforcement officers and has testified before the United States Congress on best practices to liberate children from sex slavery.

column1: Tim Ballard is currently the CEO of Operation Underground Railroad
column2: an organization that fights to dismantle child trafficking rings and rescue kids all over the world. Tim’s efforts are now being depicted in a feature film called Sound of Freedom.

column4: an online brain training and learning firm where he teaches people how to get the most out of their minds. Jim suffered a brain injury at the age of five
column5: which led to slow brain performance and left him struggling in school. As the years wore on
column6: he undertook a journey to learn about his brain – why it was “broken” and what he could do to fix it.

column1: That journey led him to discovering different learning habits
column2: including accelerated learning systems and tactics. He spent years training his brain for speed-reading and memory improvement. Companies like SpaceX and Virgin
column3: owned by billionaire geniuses like Richard Branson and Elon Musk
column4: have trained with him. He’s also trained major celebrities and political leaders such as Will Smith
column6: Oprah Winfrey
column7: and many others.

column1: Jim just released his new book Limitless: Upgrade Your Brain
column3: and Unlock Your Exceptional Life on April 28th
column4: 2020. As a kid

column1: 520 "Ns7F8PkoZ_k" "MY MINDSET HACKS FOR A GREATER LIFE | LEWIS HOWES" "2018-06-25T06:32:44Z" "Your mindset is one of the most important tools you have in life. It can make you or break you.
Many times people don’t realize the impact their thoughts and words have on their life
column3: whether it’s about their work
column4: their finances
column5: or even their health. These stories become real. They dictate your future.

column2: it’s not so simple to change the narrative you are giving yourself. A lot of times it takes a major life event to make you realize the problem. By then
column3: it can feel too late.

column1: I wanted to share this episode with you to show you 6 of the common misconceptions we have that can be holding you back. If you take the time to open your eyes to these mindset problems
column2: you can start changing your life now instead of waiting to hit rock bottom.

column1: Learn more about my mindset hacks on Episode 658.
Ways to get over self doubt and victim mentality (13:48)
How to get your work to align with your dreams (21:05)
What you need to do to connect with people (20:31)
How you should look at money (25:03)

column3: and Host of the “Business Unusual” Podcast. Barbara Corcoran’s credentials include straight D’s in high school and college and twenty jobs by the time she turned twenty-three. It was her next job that would make her one of the most successful entrepreneurs in the country when she took a $1000 loan to start The Corcoran Group.

column1: Barbara is famously brash and blunt

James did 50 Ironman Triathlons in 50 days
column2: in 50 states. He was constantly on the move for 12 hours a day
column3: running
column4: swimming
column5: and cycling. As soon as he was finished he had to travel to the next state.

column1: Most days James only had about four hours to rest. That’s no time for your body to recover. Did he hurt? Did he want to give up? Of course. But James ended up powering through
column2: breaking a Guinness World Record. At the end of the 50 days
column3: his body had began to accept this was it’s new reality and he felt like he needed to do another triathlon.

column1: Humans can push themselves so much further than you’d think. We just need to get over our mental barriers to see what we can really achieve.

The breathing exercise has a profound effect and should be practiced in the way it is explained. Always do the breathing exercise in a safe environment (e.g. sitting on a couch/floor) and unforced.
Never practice the exercises before or during diving
column3: swimming
column4: taking a bath or in any other environment/place where should you pass out
column5: a serious injury could occur. Wim Hof breathing may cause tingling sensations and/or lightheadedness. If you’ve fainted
column6: it means that you went too far. Take a step back next time.

column1: The cold is a powerful force. We strongly advise to gradually build up exposing yourself to the cold. Always train without force and listen to your body carefully. If it is not practiced responsible
column2: there is a risk of hypothermia.

column1: Do not practice the method during pregnancy or when having epilepsy. Persons with cardiovascular health issues
column3: should always consult a medical doctor before starting with the Wim Hof Method.

column3: and an amazing UFC fighter. She had a passion for martial arts even as a child but pushed her passion aside to listen to what her parents wanted. She went to college and studied things she didn’t really care about.

column1: One day she was hired to work as a ring girl at a UFC fight and watching the action up close made her decide she wanted to continue her childhood passion. As soon as the semester was over
column2: she left school and started training to be a fighter – but there was only one problem.

column1: At that time there were no UFC women. In fact
column2: the UFC was very clear they were never planning to let women into the UFC. She didn’t let that stop her. She continued to train and take small fights any chance should could.
all the hard work paid off. The UFC started letting in women fighters
column3: and she’s had an incredible career that didn’t exist not too long ago. If you’re wondering if you should actually pursue your passion
column4: no matter how unconventional it may be

Scott Harrison was working as a nightclub promoter in New York when he became “morally bankrupt.”
He sold all of his belongings and set sail to Africa in an effort to redeem himself. He returned to New York with one goal: to provide clean water to everyone on earth.

column2: he’s raised over 320 million dollars and provided water to people in 26 countries with his nonprofit charity: water.

column1: Scott now finds worth in how much money he can raise for others

column1: His book series Rich Dad Poor Dad is an international bestseller. It compares his two “dads”: one was his poor biological father and the other was his ‘fictitious’ rich dad. The poor father was actually very educated but had no money while the rich father was a high school dropout and was ‘Hawaii’s richest man’. Rich Dad Poor Dad has become the #1 bestselling personal finance book of all time! His newest book is Who Stole My Pension?: How You Can Stop the Looting.

column1: 718 "U52-i7h8a1g" "Wim Hof Talks CORONAVIRUS & How To NEVER Get Sick AGAIN | Lewis Howes" "2020-04-15T17:39:19Z" "If you want to learn how to never get sick again and protect your immune system from the coronavirus then be sure to watch this video!
Wim Hof was born in the Netherlands
column2: where winter is a way of life. As a kid
column3: he felt a sudden urge to jump into a freezing-cold river. So
column4: he did. And while most of us would immediately regret that decision and vow to never do it again … Wim went the other way and made it his profession.

column2: Wim made subjecting himself to extreme feats of cold endurance his personal claim to fame. He set a world record time (two hours
column3: 16 minutes) for a barefoot half-marathon in freezing conditions. Another for spending nearly two hours in full-body contact with a solid slab of ice. He also climbed Mount Kilimanjaro in shorts — you know
column4: it’s causal.

column1: Yet another world record almost didn’t make it into the books when Wim literally froze one of his corneas during a practice run for an under-ice distance swim
column2: but after a good night’s rest
column3: his eye healed up enough that he successfully set the record the next day.

column1: It’s straight-up superhero stuff. They call him the “Iceman” for a reason.

column2: Wim figured out that as he achieved these superhuman feats of endurance
column3: he was doing something a little different. The Wim Hof Breathing Method helped him bolster his system both prior to and during these incredible physical challenges.

column1: His special breathing method can not only help you master the elements but also take control over your own immune system. Wim Hof participated in a research study where he was injected with an endotoxin
column2: one that was supposed to make you sick within minutes but using his own breathing method and technique
column3: he was not affected. That’s right — Wim Hof gained control over his autonomous nervous system.

column1: I’ve had Wim on The School of Greatness a few times now
column2: and each time it’s so interesting to hear his perspective and see the results of his methods. Check out Episode 398
column3: Episode 799
column4: and our recent roundtable interview
column6: to hear more!

column1: Join me on Episode 941 to learn how we can strengthen our immune systems and defend ourselves against anything — even the coronavirus — with the incredible Wim Hof!" "UCKsP3v2JeT2hWI_HzkxWiMA" "Lewis Howes" "79171" "2020" "56" "0" "325" "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U52-i7h8a1g"

column9: Sara created The Spanx by Sara Blakely Foundation. She committed to donating half of her wealth to charity. Today
column10: Sara still owns 100% of the company and has never taken outside investments.

column1: Jesse enjoys living life “out of the box.” In fact
column2: he doesn’t even have a box. The author of the New York Times bestseller
column3: Living with a Seal
column4: co founded Marquis Jet
column5: the world’s largest private jet card company which he and his partner sold to Berkshire Hathaway/NetJets. Jesse then partnered with Zico coconut water
column6: which he and his partner sold to The Coca-Cola Company.

column1: He’s also the kind of person that when he wants something he grabs onto the opportunity without delay. He recently decided he needed to detox his mind from electronics and the constant multitasking of today’s world.
He ended up living with monks
column2: living in a room as small as a table
column3: and unable to communicate with his family
column4: just to find himself.

column1: The lessons he learned most were about the need to make time for yourself and the people around you that you care most about. In the end
column2: that’s where you’ll have the most impact and where your true legacy will come from.

column6: motivated and educated with the SCHOOL OF GREATNESS. lewishowes.com/book" "UCKsP3v2JeT2hWI_HzkxWiMA" "Lewis Howes" "15703" "704" "10" "0" "38" "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=unv94JdqUgc"

column2: I GREW UP AS AN ATHLETE.
played pretty much every sport in high school
column3: and went on to play arena football professionally.

column1: My entire childhood was built on beliefs about what \"masculinity\" is
column2: from being in the locker rooms
column3: to what coaches would say to me over and over
column4: to society

column1: I was raped when I was five by a man that I didn't know
column2: the babysitter's son. I didn’t tell anyone about it. I remember having all this resentment
column3: anger
column4: frustration and defensiveness built up inside of me.

column1: I became so driven to prove everyone wrong
column2: so driven to be number one and to never lose.

column1: I was driven to be the best athlete I could be.
A lot of it came from feeling like I wasn't good enough for who I was.

column3: so I was very driven to achieve. And I did.

column1: I achieved everything I wanted. I seemed to have it all: a New York Times bestselling book
column3: a multi-million dollar business.

column2: I had reached the pinnacle of success by anyone’s measure.

column1: Night after night on my book tour for The School of Greatness
column2: I would lay down only to feel deep and profound loneliness in an impersonal hotel room.

column1: I may have reached the pinnacle of success
column2: but I had no one to share it with.

column1: I had no intimacy or deep connection with anyone else.

column2: I would have ignored these emotions. \"Man up
column3: \" I would have told myself. \"Quit being so soft.\" But as the book tour came to a close
column4: I decided it was time to do things differently. It was time to take massive action.

column1: So I went on a personal journey to find inner peace and uncover the many masks that men - like myself - wear.
I had life-changing conversations with some of the world’s best psychologists
column3: and household names
column4: such as Tony Robbins
column6: and Ray Lewis. And through it all
column7: I discovered what it really takes to remove the mask of masculinity.

column1: I realized there are so many men out there struggling because of these ideas of \"masculinity.\"
The Mask of Masculinity: How Men Can Embrace Vulnerability
column3: and Live Their Fullest Lives is the result of this transformational journey.

column1: I know there are a lot of people talking about vulnerability
column3: and similar topics
column4: but as a jock growing up in America
column5: none of my peers would've ever listened to any of those messages from those people.

column1: I want to connect with the men who are not open to hearing this message
column2: in a way that will resonate with them.

column1: I want women to understand the men in their lives better.

column3: and incredible interviews
column4: I uncovered the 9 masks of masculinity: the hidden psychological and emotional barriers that hold men back from true fulfillment. In each chapter
column5: we explore the depths of a different mask.

column2: The Mask of Masculinity will be the start of a life-changing journey.

column1: Many men have worn their masks for so long that they forget who they are underneath. Removing the masks
column3: will not be easy.

column1: It will be terrifying. It will be painful. But it’s in the most difficult and challenging journeys that we find the most meaning. Stripped of the masks of masculinity
column2: men can find true fulfillment. They can love. They can connect. They can find the freedom to be themselves again.

column1: 742 "uTrXh50JQoQ" "Create the Opposite of Hate with Sally Kohn and Lewis Howes" "2018-04-23T16:05:19Z" "Thank you for watching this powerful interview with Sally Kohn!
Sally Kohn is a CNN commentator who has attracted huge amounts of haters during her career as a political speaker. As our society has gotten more divided
column2: hate seems to be taking over a lot of actions and discussions. So Sally decided to do a deep dive study on why we hate and what the opposite of that is. She talked to her own haters
column3: she traveled to countries that have experienced genocides
column4: and she discussed the psychological pieces of what’s going on.

column1: This was a powerful conversation about a topic that isn’t always easy to discuss. I really appreciated Sally’s willingness and honesty in discussing how we can each shift our habits out of hate and bias and into open-mindedness and respect. No matter what you’ve been through or what you believe
column2: I know there’s something valuable to learn for all of us in Episode 631.

column1: Check out the show notes here: https://www.lewishowes.com/631
-What getting hate mail taught Sally about her own ability to be mean (3:05)
-The difference between our brain’s hardware and its software (8:15)
-What happens when we wear “masks” to hide our true identity (18:50)
-Why it’s important to talk to people who believe differently than you do (21:45)
-How mass atrocities can happen (and be avoided) (27:20)
-Why we don’t usually see ourselves as the starters of hate (38:37)

column1: 747 "uVZlO0ifj2w" "Lewis Howes Presents: Chasing Greatness - THE MOVIE!" "2020-01-31T18:39:55Z" "Get your tickets today: https://www.greatness.com/

I have a confession to make - I’ve been keeping a little bit of a secret. But the time has finally come to share with you - and the world - something I’m tremendously excited about. For the past two years
column2: my team and I have been working on a documentary film. It’s called Chasing Greatness. And I can’t wait to share it with you.

column1: It’s all about what greatness means. Harnessing your dreams. Overcoming your fears. Realizing your power. Achieving your best life. And showing a career-spanning level of appreciation for you
column2: and all you’ve done to make the most of all we are together.

column1: The film takes you on a seven-day behind the scenes journey of our life-changing annual event
column2: The Summit of Greatness. More than 1
column3: 500 people travel from around the world to attend each year in my hometown Columbus
column4: Ohio. You’ll witness candid conversations with my family
column6: backstage production
column7: and never before seen sit-downs with our speakers on how we can all reach our highest potential.

column1: New York Times Best-Selling Author Lewis Howes
column2: is on a mission to inspire humanity to achieve greatness by overcoming fear
column3: self-doubt
column4: and adversity. His podcast The School of Greatness has been downloaded over 150 million times and provides powerful tools for people to take their lives to the next level. Watch as these world-class leaders weigh in on life's biggest questions and challenges as we journey on the path to greatness!

column4: you need to be innovative.

column1: Innovation is all about assessing the situation. See what’s working and what’s not. Sometimes you may need an outsider’s view to see the problem areas. Most importantly

column1: They are constantly trying to reach out and tell you exactly what it is they want — even though it’s not always with their words. column2: author of the book ‘Extreme Ownership: How U.S. Navy SEALs Lead and Win

column1: Jocko spent 20 years in the U.S. Navy SEAL Teams
column2: starting as an enlisted SEAL and rising the ranks to become a SEAL officer. As commander of SEAL Team Three’s Task Unit Bruiser during the battle of Ramadi
column3: he orchestrated SEAL operations that helped the “Ready First” Brigade of the U.S. Army’s First Armored Division bring stability to the violent
column4: war-torn city. Task Unit Bruiser became the most highly decorated Special Operations Unit of the Iraq War. Jocko returned from Iraq to serve as Officer-In-Charge of Training for all West Coast SEAL Teams. There he spearheaded the development of leadership training and personally instructed and mentored the next generation of SEAL leaders who have continued to perform with great success on the battlefield.

column2: Jocko retired from the Navy and launched Echelon Front with Leif Babin
column3: where he teaches the leadership principles he learned on the battlefield to help others lead and win.
